markdownRemark.html:
[domElement].classList

Configure the class for element. Available options:

.add(className) add class

.remove(className) remove class

.toggle(className) toggle class

[domElement].dataset

Get all the data attributes

  • [domElement].dataset.event is the equivalent to [domElement].getAttribute('data-event')
  • [domElement].dataset.placeName is the equivalent to [domElement].getAttribute('data-place-name')

window.matchMedia('only all and (max-width: 1000px)')

Detect is current screen match the media query

[domElement].textContent

Get the text within the dom element

[domElement].matchesSelector('li a')

Detect whether the dom element match the selector

children.value: How to setup React SPA from scratch in 2020 (Unformatted Article)
to create manifest (package.json) of your project
yarn add react react-dom prop-types babel-polyfill
yarn add -D webpack webpack-cli webpack-dev-server @babel/core @babel/preset-env @babel/preset-react babel-cli babel-loader html-webpack-plugin
You need to enable Javascript to run this app.
, create a script : webpack-dev-server --mode development --open --config webpack.config.js
yarn start`, browser will auto open the project, modify the App.jsx, hot reload should works

Update landing page into following code

Landing Page

Example Page

Non Exist Page

## Setup Redux, Redux saga and debugging tools
1. `yarn add react-redux redux redux-saga connected-react-router redux-devtools-extension redux-logger`
2. Create a file `reducers/index.js`, with following code
```js
import { combineReducers } from 'redux'
import { connectRouter } from 'connected-react-router'

const reducers = {}

const rootReducer = history =>
  combineReducers({
    router: connectRouter(history),
    ...reducers
  })

export default rootReducer

4. Update following file `src/index.js` into following
```js
import 'babel-polyfill'
import React from 'react'
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'
import App from './App'

import reducers from './reducers'
import { Provider } from 'react-redux'
import { createStore, applyMiddleware } from 'redux'
import createSagaMiddleware from 'redux-saga'
import { composeWithDevTools } from 'redux-devtools-extension'
import { createBrowserHistory } from 'history'
import { routerMiddleware, ConnectedRouter } from 'connected-react-router'
import logger from 'redux-logger'
import rootSaga from './sagas'

const history = createBrowserHistory()
const sagaMiddleware = createSagaMiddleware()

const middlewares = [
  sagaMiddleware,
  process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' && logger,
  routerMiddleware(history)
].filter(Boolean)

const store = createStore(
  reducers(history),
  {},
  process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development'
    ? composeWithDevTools(applyMiddleware(...middlewares))
    : applyMiddleware(...middlewares)
)

sagaMiddleware.run(rootSaga)

ReactDOM.render(
  <Provider store={store}>
    <App />
  </Provider>, document.getElementById('root'))
5, Navigate to landing page, and refresh, open console tab, you should see the
message a logger for the push event.
You can also download redux dev tools extension and react debugger
yarn add -D eslint babel-eslint eslint-plugin-react prettier prettier-stylelint husky lint-staged stylelint-prettier
Install eslint extension, you should see eslint report an error in
Add following code in the same level with scripts
Your code will now auto prettify in pre commit stage

const autoprefixer = require('autoprefixer')
const MiniCssExtractPlugin = require('mini-css-extract-plugin')
3. `yarn build` will not generate a production build
